snippet: CW Capital, which controls Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village, will rescind mid-lease increases for tenants who submit affidavits that they were misled.
abstract: CW Capital, which controls Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village in Manhattan, will rescind mid-lease increases for tenants who submit affidavits that they were misled;  rent increases came after court decision that found complex's former owners had illegally deregulated 4,300 apartments; ruling led settlement, which provided $173 million in rent rebates for tenants but also established higher rents for certain apartments.
lead_paragraph: CW Capital, which controls Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village, will rescind mid-lease increases for tenants who submit affidavits that they were misled.

headline.main: Manhattan’s Biggest Apartment Complex Agrees to Drop Some Rent Increases
headline.print_headline: Manhattan’s Biggest Apartment Complex to Drop Some Rent Increases
